content.title: Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti
content.beneficiary: Economically disadvantaged students belonging to marginalized communities
content.details: Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti under the Higher Education Department of Madhya Pradesh Government provides financial assistance to economically disadvantaged students belonging to these marginalized communities. The scheme helps alleviate financial burdens associated with tuition fees, maintenance allowances, and other incidental expenses. Enabling access to education for these underprivileged groups promotes social equity and empowers them to pursue higher studies and better livelihood opportunities.
benefits: Monthly subsistence allowance for different classes
Reimbursement of full tuition fees and other mandatory fees for self-financed courses
Payment of fees for enrolment/registration, tuition, sports, uniform, library, magazines, medical check-ups, etc.
eligibility: The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh belonging to a backward class.
The applicant should have passed in the previous class.
The total annual income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti scheme is a government initiative aimed at providing financial assistance to economically disadvantaged students belonging to marginalized communities.

faqs.question: What educational levels does the Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti cover?
faqs.answer: This scholarship covers post-secondary education, starting from class 11 onwards, including undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in recognized institutions.

faqs.question: How does one apply for the Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti scholarship?
faqs.answer: Students can apply for the scholarship through the designated online portal.

faqs.question: What are the documents required for the application process?
faqs.answer: Commonly required documents include proof of identity, caste certificate, income certificate, and bank account details.

faqs.question: Is there any specific income criteria for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The total annual income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What expenses does the scholarship cover, and to what extent?
faqs.answer: The scholarship typically covers expenses such as tuition fees, maintenance allowances, and other incidental expenses required for education.

faqs.question: Can students from all states of India avail of this scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, only Madhya Pradesh students can apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can I apply offline?
faqs.answer: According to the guidelines, this scheme can be applied online only.

faqs.question: How much amount will be paid in post graduate hostel?
faqs.answer: ₹450/- amount will be paid in the post-graduate hostel.

faqs.question: How much amount will be paid in graduate hostel?
faqs.answer: ₹400/- amount will be paid in the graduate hostel.
